column1: The Free Peoples of the World were those people who were not under Saurons domination.
By the later Third Age Sauron had Orcs
column2: Trolls and other creatures under his control
column3: and other peoples like the Men of Darkness enslaved or allied with him. As such
column4: the Free Peoples were the Elves
column8: and any folk who opposed him.

column2: Boromir made a mention of the "Free Lords of the Free"
column3: possibly referring to the rulers of the Free Peoples
column7: entry "Free Lords of the Free" while suggesting that they should use the One Ring against Sauron.

column1: The members of the Fellowship of the Ring were specifically chosen so that at least one representative of all the free peoples would be there: one for the Elves
column2: one for the Dwarves and two for Men. As they had appeared relatively late in the knowledge of most
column3: Hobbits were generally not reckoned among them until the War of the Ring.

column1: 2001: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring:

column2: the term "Free Peoples of Middle-earth" is used to describe those that formed the Last Alliance of Elves and Men.The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring (extended edition)
column3: "Prologue: One Ring to Rule Them All..."

column1: 2004: The Lord of the Rings: War of the Ring:
:"Free Peoples" is one of the playable factions
column2: the other being "Minions of Sauron". Its troops include Men of Gondor and Rohan

column1: 2007: The Lord of the Rings Online:

:The term "Free Peoples" is generally used to identify the "good" faction in the MonsterPlay sessions. It is often abbreviated as "Freeps"."http://lotro.wikia.com/wiki/Freeps Freeps" at http://lotro.wikia.com/wiki/Main_Page lotro.wikia.com
